qas.question: Where did Jews migrate to after the Babylonian conquest?
Between what years did Jews increase to an estimated 2 million?
Name one thing that has accounted for Jewish population growth?
Where did the Jews migrate to before the Babylonian conquest?
How many Jews lived in Babylonia before the 1st century?
How many Jews lived in Babylonia after 500 CE?
How did the Jewish population increase before the 1st century?
How many Jews lived outside of the Roman Empire?

context: By the 1st century, <a0_0><b3_0>Babylonia<b3_0/><a0_0/>, to which Jews migrated to after the Babylonian conquest as well as after the Bar Kokhba revolt in 135 CE, already held a speedily growing population of an estimated <b4_0>1,000,000<b4_0/> Jews, which increased to an estimated <b5_0>2 million<b5_0/>  between the years <a1_0>200 CE – 500 CE<a1_0/>, both by natural growth and by immigration of more Jews from the Land of Israel, making up about 1/6 of the world Jewish population at that era. At times <a2_0>conversion<a2_0/> has accounted for a part of Jewish population growth. Some have claimed that in the 1st century of the Christian era, for example, the population <b6_0>more than doubled<b6_0/>, from four to <b7_0>8–10 million<b7_0/> within the confines of the Roman Empire, in good part as a result of a wave of conversion.
